oai_dc:dc.dc:title: President's message to members of the Civilian Conservation Corps
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Text of President Franklin D. Roosevelt's radio message concerning the CCC is reproduced here in a 1937 CCC yearbook. The CCC insignia at the bottom of the page is enhanced with the specifications of Camp Cordell Hull in red and green marker.; The message is titled, "The Admiration of the Entire Country."

This volume of the "Official Annual of the Civilian Conservation Corps, 'C' District CCC, Fourth Area, 1937" was donated by James O. Rickman of Johnson City, TN. Rickman was with Camp Cordell Hull, Co. 1455, F-5 in the Unaka Range; of the Cherokee National Forest, and it is assumed that he enhanced the CCC insignia on this introductory page with the specifications of his camp. The CCC (1933-1942) employed nearly 3 million men who worked on conservation projects.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Civilian Conservation Corps in Tennessee Collection, 1933-1942
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.); Civilian Conservation Corps (U.S.) -- History; New Deal, 1933-1939; Roosevelt, Franklin D. (Franklin Delano), 1882-1945
